lines.gurmukhi: ^wlsy ky pRswd kr suq ibq kos Bfwr ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: All my wealth, stowed in storehouse and treasury, is due to the grace of the Khalsa.

lines.gurmukhi: rwj mwl swdn skl puqR kilqR ibvhwr ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Like a kingdom, with its wealth and mansions, its men and their wives each perform their appointed tasks. 528

lines.gurmukhi: lSkr nyb KÍws iBRq Anucr dwsI dws ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Though I be an army's chief leader, yet I am the lowliest servant of all.

lines.gurmukhi: imqR kutMb Dn Bvn mm simRiD ikrpw kr qws ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Friends, family, wealth, mansions, riches, and mercy — all come by the grace [of the Khalsa]. 529

lines.gurmukhi: igrMbwrI Aru swihbI qn mn ipMf pRwn ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Leading the household, command over all, body and soul, my physique and my breath — Gifts, greatness, and honour,

lines.gurmukhi: pRswid ^wlsy kr imilE dwn mwn snmwn ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: all I receive, are due to the grace of the Khalsa. 530

lines.gurmukhi: ikRpwvMq ^wls sgl qh pRswid BXo gOr ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: The whole of the Khalsa, to which grace has been given, makes me worthy of honour and glory.

lines.gurmukhi: moih sy rMk AnwQ jg Btkq iPrq kror ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Penniless and without leaders are people without number who [without the Khalsa] like me are astray in this world. 531

lines.gurmukhi: Awn syv nih sPl kC eIq aUq prlok ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: False service is fruitless, here on earth or in the other world.

lines.gurmukhi: inhPl syvw iqs ibnw kbI krK kib sog ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Fruitless service lacks effect, sometimes happy, sometimes sad. 533
Religious offering and worship is [my duty to] my Khalsa; mighty it is and worthy of worship.

lines.gurmukhi: dws goibMd &qh ^wlsw drs prs imty sog ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: The servant of Gobind [Singh] proclaims the victory of the Khalsa, the sight and touch [of which] wipes every sadness away. 534

lines.gurmukhi: myro ieSt Ar nySnw ^wlsw pUjn iDAwn ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: My own and trusted [one is] the Khalsa, [worthy of] worship and meditation.

lines.gurmukhi: drsn prsn ^wlsw mukq rUp sq jwn ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: The sight and touch of the Khalsa confers liberation and truth on the soul. 535

lines.gurmukhi: Awqm rs ijh jwnhI so hY ^wls dyv ]

W. H. McLeod.translation: Only he who knows its true depths is [a member of] the divine Khalsa.

lines.gurmukhi: pRB mih mo mih qws mih rMck nwhn Byd ]

W. H. McLeod.translation:
Between the Lord, myself, and it no trace of difference 
exists. 536
